Package com.game.myGame

Class Sprite

java.lang.Object
com.game.myGame.Sprite
Direct Known Subclasses:
Enemy, Fire, Present, Santa
public class Sprite
extends java.lang.Object
This class is meant to be the super class of every character or object that appears in the game.
Author:
matte

  • Constructor Details

    • Sprite

      public Sprite​(int posX, int posY, java.lang.String name, ImageLoader imgL)
      The public constructor. It takes the x and y starting position, a name and the image loader
      Parameters:
      posX - x starting position
      posY - y starting position
      name - name for the sprite
      imgL - The image loader for animation

  • Method Details

    • setImage

      public void setImage​(java.lang.String imgName)
      It sets the image associated with the sprite
      Parameters:
      imgName - The name of the sprite

    • setDirection

      public void setDirection​(boolean rightDirection)
      It sets the direction of the sprite(right or left).
      Parameters:
      rightDirection - True if facing right

    • startLooping

      public void startLooping​(int animPeriod, double seqDuration)
      Total duration of the animation is seqDuration(in seconds), the ticking interval in milliseconds is animPeriod
      Parameters:
      animPeriod - Milliseconds ticking interval
      seqDuration - Seconds Total duration of the animation

    • setImageDimension

      public void setImageDimension​(java.awt.Dimension d)
      change the sprite dimensions
      Parameters:
      d - The new Dimensions

    • stopLooping

      public void stopLooping()
      It stops the loop of the sprite

    • getMyRectangle

      public java.awt.Rectangle getMyRectangle()
      It returns a rectangle that has the same dimensions and positions of the image of the sprite
      Returns:

    • updateSprite

      public void updateSprite()
      It updates the movements variables of the sprite

    • paintSprite

      public void paintSprite​(java.awt.Graphics g)
      It paints the sprite in a offscreen graphics, for buffering purpose only.
      Parameters:
      g - The offscreen graphics

    • move

      public void move​(boolean rightDirection)
      Move the sprite following the modifications of the method updateSprite. It takes a boolean rightDirection as a parameter: true if facing right
      Parameters:
      rightDirection - true if facing right

    • moveUp

      public void moveUp​(boolean rightDirection)
      It moves up the screen the sprite
      Parameters:
      rightDirection - True if facing right

    • moveDown

      public void moveDown​(boolean rightDirection)
      Moves down the sprite
      Parameters:
      rightDirection - True if facing right

    • run

      public void run​(boolean rightDirection)
      It sets the running animation facing right if the given parameter is true
      Parameters:
      rightDirection - True if the animation should be facing right

    • stop

      public void stop​(boolean rightDirection)
      It stops the movement of the sprite. It takes a boolean rightDirection as a parameter: true if facing right
      Parameters:
      rightDirection - true if facing right

    • getPosY

      public int getPosY()
      Returns:
      The y position

    • isActive

      public boolean isActive()
      Returns:
      If it's active

    • getDx

      public int getDx()
      Returns:
      The dx parameter, that is the step of movement in the x axis

    • setDx

      public void setDx​(int dx)
      It sets the new movement
      Parameters:
      dx - The steps of movement

    • getDy

      public int getDy()
      Returns:
      The dy parameter, that is the step of movement in the y axis

    • setDy

      public void setDy​(int dy)
      Parameters:
      dy - Set the dy parameter, that is the step of movement in the y axis

    • isLooping

      public boolean isLooping()
      Returns:
      If it's looping

      Parameters:

      Returns:

    • setPosY

      public void setPosY​(int y)
      Parameters:
      y - Set the position in the y axis

    • isRightDirection

      public boolean isRightDirection()
      Returns:
      If it's facing right

      public java.lang.String getName()
      Returns:
